page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: The Main Street area of Roos appears to be the oldest part of the village with many old cottages and houses.New development in Main Street is terraced to blend with the old.Several cottages were originally shops now there are three shops:a butchers,SPAR-general store including the Post Office,and Hinch's-a sweet and paper shop which sells petrol.The Old School,now derelict and the Institute are also in this area.Down Pilmar Lane there is most development including private housing and Eastfield Estate, a housing development for the elderly.In Main Street there are also two public houses:the Black Horse and the Roos Arms.The latter also being a resturant.There are two farms:Manor Farm and Eastfield farm and down Hodgson there are some allotments.
